alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Crawford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 1:37AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cherokee and Crawford Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 136 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Bronson to Parsons to South Coffeyville. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburg, Baxter Springs, Frontenac, Columbus, Galena, Girard, Arma, Cherokee, Weir, Lowell, Sherman, Mulberry, Scammon, Chicopee, Mccune, Franklin, Arcadia, Walnut, West Mineral and Treece. This includes Interstate 44 near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
